.
Effect of a Surviving Spouse’s Renouncement of the Right to DIC on the Veteran’s Surviving Children
If a surviving spouse renounces the right to DIC
any child on the surviving spouse’s award that is under the age of 18 also loses the right to DIC (unless the child is entitled to DIC based on the death of a different Veteran-parent), and
the surviving spouse’s renouncement will
not
have the effect of increasing the rate of DIC payable to a child or children over the age of 18.
title: M21-1, Part X, Subpart iv, Chapter 4  - Renouncements
